titleStmt.title: A silver watch-bell The sound wherof is able (by the grace of God) to win the most profane worldling, and carelesse liuer, if there be but the least sparke of grace remaining in him, to become a true Christian indeed, that in the end he may obtaine euerlasting saluation. Wherunto is annexed a treatise of the holy Sacrament of the Lords Supper.
titleStmt.author: Tymme, Thomas, d. 1620.

publicationStmt.publisher: By T. C[reede] for William Cotton, and are to be sold at his shop adioyning to Ludgate,

notesStmt.note: Includes, with caption title: The court of conscience: wherein euery sinner may examine and trie himselfe, whether he be fitly prepared to receiue the blessed sacrament of the Lords supper.
Pages 127, 140 and 278 misnumbered 27, 142 and 248; pages 129-30 missing in number only.
Some print show-through and some pages marked and stained; pages 143-44 lacking.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
